channel.title: Relativity of the coordinates on different planes
channel.description:
Does anyone have information especially on the relativity of the coordinates of the underground plane to the ground level? I'm asking about this because I realized RSBuddy doesn't have a global walking system, and fuck no am I going to pull a Ruler and [i]take a walk[/i].
So, anyone know what kind of math needs to be applied to translate e.g the ground level coordinates (3000, 3000) to underground coordinates (15000, 15000)? (In this example I'd take a ladder down at 3000, 3000, and then need to calculate my position in the underground plane so that I know what to do to get to (15000, 15000).)

item.title: Relativity of the coordinates on different planes
item.dc:creator: @cookies222 cookies222
item.description:
@cookies222 wrote:

the 6400 crap was because rs didnt/(doesnt?) support more then 4 or was it 3, height levels
the 6400 offset is used for dungeons that should of been heightlevel -1

Read full topic
item.source: Relativity of the coordinates on different planes

item.title: Relativity of the coordinates on different planes
item.dc:creator: @slavemaster veer
item.description:
@slavemaster wrote:

As far as I know it is still as simple as offsetting your position by 6400 or so as already mentioned.

Read full topic
item.source: Relativity of the coordinates on different planes

item.title: Relativity of the coordinates on different planes
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“slavemaster, post:7, topic:407590”][quote author=the bank link=topic=508869.msg3699466#msg3699466 date=1312658299]
Or deob the client and locate each change in the X-Y of tiles, and find one involving the current plane.
[/quote]
Erm… what? Perhaps I don’t understand, but the client doesn’t handle object interactions, server-side scripts do.[/quote]Of course, my bad :o

Either way it shouldn’t be too hard to debug just through trial and error.

Read full topic

item.description:

the bank:

Or deob the client and locate each change in the X-Y of tiles, and find one involving the current plane.

Erm… what? Perhaps I don’t understand, but the client doesn’t handle object interactions, server-side scripts do.

item.title: Relativity of the coordinates on different planes
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Just go down levels in different places. Check you first differences, second differences etc. It may just be an arithmetic/geometric sequence.

EDIT:
Or deob the client and locate each change in the X-Y of tiles, and find one involving the current plane.

Read full topic
item.source: Relativity of the coordinates on different planes

item.dc:creator: @n3ss3s n3ss3s

Hmm… IIRC I recall having to declare a plane for object finding or something, so there probably is more to it than +6400…

Read full topic

item.title: Relativity of the coordinates on different planes
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

n3ss3s:

Well that’s what I want to know, but yeah you still end up with a ginormous number…

I just stood in Varrock castle kitchen, and went to the basement, and all it did was add 6400 to my y position. The x position changed by about 2, but that shouldn’t make much of a difference.

Read full topic
